topic: here’s what’s happening now with mortgage rates after trump's latest push on housing affordability

text: Mortgage rates are changing again due to former President Trump's latest push on housing affordability.
The average 30-year fixed mortgage rate has decreased slightly.
The Federal Reserve is monitoring interest rates to align with economic growth.
Trump's plan aims to increase access to affordable housing for low and middle-income families.
The plan proposes changes to mortgage insurance premiums and down payment requirements.
It's unclear how these changes will impact the overall housing market.
The goal is to make homeownership more accessible to all.
We will investigate the impact of these changes further.
The changes may have a significant effect on the economy.
Low and middle-income families may be affected the most.
The Federal Reserve's actions will be crucial in determining the outcome.
Only time will tell if the plan will be successful.
We will continue to monitor the situation and provide updates.
